projects.title: Supply of statistical services — methodological studies in the field of agro-environmental indicators (Service contracts 40701.2011.002-2011.312 and 40701.2012.002-2012.316)
projects.description: During my work in Eurostat I was involved in the project management of two projects carried out by Alterra, Wageningen University. The first project was issued by Eurostat as a first step to improve and harmonise methodologies and concepts used for the estimation of nitrogen and phosphorous contents of animal excretion by member states and different EU and international policies.  The second project was issued by Eurostat to improve definitions and classifications used in statistics on grasslands and to improve data collection on the different types of grasslands, grassland productivity, biodiversity and other environmental indicators. I have been involved in drafting the technical specifications of the service contracts, organizing and leading project meetings, evaluation of project reports and progress.

projects.title: DireDate (Service Contract 40701.2009.001-2009.354)
projects.description:
During my work in Eurostat I was involved in the project management of the DireDate project, a project carried out by Alterra, Wageningen University. 
The aim of this research project was to create a framework for setting up a sustainable system
for collecting a set of data from farmers and other sources that will serve primarily European and national statisticians for creating the agreed 28 agri-environmental indicators (AEIs) and thus serve policy makers, but as well agricultural and environmental researchers, observers of climate change and other environmental issues linked to agriculture. The project results were published on a dedicated website and on the dedicated section on agri-environmental indicators on the website of Eurostat. The latter website has been included as project URL.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible Officer in Eurostat for the development of agri-environmental indicators (AEI): nutrient budgets, fertiliser statistics, greenhouse gas emissions, ammonia emissions, manure management etc. In this capacity I endeavoured to harmonise methodologies and concepts used among European countries and outside Europe: I was the coordinator with other DG`s of the European Commission on these topics as well as organisations like the OECD, FAO, UNECE Taskforce on Reactive Nitrogen. I wrote and developed the European Handbook on the estimation of Nutrient Budgets (2013).
I have extensive experience with organising and leading international meetings, in Eurostat I organised and led several meetings with the delegates of the Member States on Agri-Environmental Indicators. As project owner I have developed and controlled diverse international research projects tendered by the European Commission. In Eurostat I also was responsible for data collection, validation and quality control and publication. Publications include statistical articles in Eurostat pocketbooks on agricultural statistics and articles on agri-environmental indicators in the new medium of Eurostat (comparable with Wikipedia) Statistics Explained.

From April 2010 untill January 2012 I worked at the European Commission as a seconded national expert. In January 2012, I concluded the competition to become a statistical officer at the European Commission sucessfully and became a probationary officer in the Commission and in September 2013 I was established in my post as Statistical Officer.
profile_positions.title: Statistical Officer

profile_positions.description:
At Statistics Netherlands I have worked for the environmental department and the energy department before I was seconded to Eurostat in april 2010.

At the energy department I researched and developed methods to estimate energy consumption of households and service industries from registered data of energy providers, household registers, GIS data etc. to study and analyse relations between energy consumption and household characteristics.

At the environmental department I carried out two pilot-projects for Eurostat:
- the project ‘Regional Gross Nutrient Balances` in which I developed a procedure to estimate
nutrient balances at lower regional levels. This project led also to improvements in diverse statistics, such as the annually estimated nutrient balances at national level and grassland statistics.
- the project ‘Fertiliser Statistics’ in which I analysed possibilities to use existing data sources to
estimate agricultural fertiliser consumption.
profile_positions.title: Statistical researcher
